Pre-Game Insights: The record of India being undefeated against Pakistan in World Cups since 1992 was lost last year with a score of India 12-1 Pakistan.
India returns to the pitch 364 days later, aiming to reverse the jinx and bring back the smile on fans' faces.
Batting is India's stronger suit while bowling is Pakistan's, which was decisive in the 2021 T20 World Cup.
The match is expected to be a high-stakes contest with plenty of drama and off-the-field cheering.
Miscellaneous Highlights: There is an 80% chance of rain, which could affect the match.
The head-to-head record shows India has won 8 T20Is and 5 T20 World Cups against Pakistan, while Pakistan has won 3 T20Is and 1 T20 World Cup.
Rohit Sharma is the highest run-scorer in the current team with 3737 runs, while Babar Azam is second with 3231 runs.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Yuzvendra Chahal are the highest wicket-takers in the current team with 85 wickets each, while Shadab Khan leads Pakistan with 87 wickets.
India has won 4 out of 7 matches in Australia across formats against Pakistan, while Pakistan has won 3.
